headline: Trump's Venezuela Meeting Is Shaping Up to Be a Who's Who of US Oil
summary: Nearly 20 oil executives, including veteran wildcatter Harold Hamm, are slated to meet President Donald Trump and top officials at the White House Friday as the administration pushes them to rebuild Venezuela’s battered energy sector.  The scheduled lineup is a Who’s Who of American oil titans, with representatives from Chevron Corp., Exxon Mobil Corp., ConocoPhillips and other companies responding to Trump’s call to discuss potentially reviving Venezuela’s production, which has plummeted amid years of disrepair, fading investment and the exodus of foreign companies.

content.title: Trump's Venezuela Meeting Is Shaping Up to Be a Who's Who of US Oil
content.summary: Nearly 20 oil executives, including veteran wildcatter Harold Hamm, are slated to meet President Donald Trump and top officials at the White House Friday as the administration pushes them to rebuild Venezuela’s battered energy sector. headline: Why Trump Underestimates the Challenge of Reviving Venezuela’s Oil
summary: Venezuela’s oil sector is deeply degraded, with production far below capacity and infrastructure in “catastrophic” condition.

headline: Trump Says Oil Majors Will Invest $100 Billion in Venezuela
summary: President Trump said early Friday that American oil companies would pour $100 billion of investment into Venezuela to jumpstart its oil industry. Trump's social-media post came hours before he is expected to meet representatives of Chevron, Exxon Mobil, ConocoPhillips and other oil companies at the White House to discuss investing in Venezuela.

headline: Trump meets with oil executives at the White House on Friday, seeking investments in Venezuela
summary: President Donald Trump is meeting with oil executives at the White House on Friday in hopes of securing $100 billion in investments to revive Venezuela’s ability to fully tap into its expansive reserves of petroleum — a plan that rides on their comfort in making commitments in a country plagued by instability, inflation and uncertainty.  Since the U.S. military raid to capture former Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro on Saturday, Trump has quickly pivoted to portraying the move as a newfound economic opportunity for the U.S., seizing three tankers carrying Venezuelan oil, saying the U.S. is taking over the sales of 30 million to 50 million barrels of previously sanctioned Venezuelan oil and will be controlling sales worldwide indefinitely.

content.title: Trump meets with oil executives at the White House on Friday, seeking investments in Venezuela
content.summary: President Donald Trump is meeting with oil executives at the White House on Friday in hopes of securing $100 billion in investments to revive Venezuela’s ability to fully tap into its expansive reserves of petroleum — a plan that rides on their comfort in making commitments in a country plagued by instability, inflation and uncertainty.  Since the U.S. military raid to capture former Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro on Saturday, Trump has quickly pivoted to portraying the move as a newfound economic opportunity for the U.S., seizing three tankers carrying Venezuelan oil, saying the U.S. is taking over the sales of 30 million to 50 million barrels of previously sanctioned Venezuelan oil and will be controlling sales worldwide indefinitely.

thumbnail.caption: President Donald Trump waves as he walks off stage after speaking to House Republican lawmakers during their annual policy retreat, Tuesday, Jan. 6, 2026, in Washington. (AP Photo/Evan Vucci)

headline: Morningstar’s Dividend ETF Is Kind of Perfect for Retirees Right Now
summary: When retirement income depends on dividends that actually arrive, sector concentration stops being a flaw and starts looking like conviction. The First Trust Morningstar Dividend Leaders Index Fund (NYSEARCA:FDL) dedicates 26% of its portfolio to energy stocks at a moment when the Trump administration has announced indefinite control over Venezuelan oil sales. headline: Consumer sentiment rises to 4-month high, retail stocks drop
summary: Yahoo Finance's John Hyland tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including retail stocks' reactions to the Supreme Court delaying their decision on President Trump's tariff policies, US consumer sentiment rising to its highest level since September 2025, and TD Cowen analysts forecast Chevron (CVX) could see a $700 million per year boost from Venezuelan oil production (CL=F, BZ=F). Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Chevron Could Add Up to $700 Million Annually From Venezuela
summary: TD Cowen estimates higher Venezuelan output could contribute $400 million to $700 million a year, representing roughly 1% to 2% of Chevron's operating cash flow.

headline: Former Venezuela Diplomat Sees 'Western Hemisphere Energy Corridor'
summary: The news cycle has been frenetic since a U.S. military strike on Jan. 3 captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife, and flew them to New York City to face criminal charges.  President Donald Trump early in the week told the media U.S. oil companies will need to make "big investments" in Venezuela's oil infrastructure.  On Thursday, Trump said top oil companies had pledged to spend $100 billion to rebuild Venezuela's flagging oil sector.

content.title: Former Venezuela Diplomat Sees 'Western Hemisphere Energy Corridor'
content.summary: The news cycle has been frenetic since a U.S. military strike on Jan. 3 captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife, and flew them to New York City to face criminal charges.  President Donald Trump early in the week told the media U.S. oil companies will need to make "big investments" in Venezuela's oil infrastructure.  On Thursday, Trump said top oil companies had pledged to spend $100 billion to rebuild Venezuela's flagging oil sector.

headline: Drifting Tanker Reveals Major Hurdle for Trump Plan to Revive Venezuela’s Oil
summary: The Sea Maverick, which has been linked to the so-called dark fleet of tankers carrying sanctioned Russian oil, has been circling near the Venezuelan coast since early January after the US intensified a blockade of the country, according to analytics firm Vortexa.  It’s carrying about 380,000 barrels of naphtha, a petroleum product Venezuela needs to thin out its thick, sludgy crude so it can flow through pipelines for export.  In an interview with Fox Business Network on Thursday, US Secretary of the Interior Doug Burgum reaffirmed Washington’s intent to “knock Russia out of the Venezuelan oil market,” including by prohibiting the sale of Russian naphtha to Caracas.

content.title: Drifting Tanker Reveals Major Hurdle for Trump Plan to Revive Venezuela’s Oil
content.summary: The Sea Maverick, which has been linked to the so-called dark fleet of tankers carrying sanctioned Russian oil, has been circling near the Venezuelan coast since early January after the US intensified a blockade of the country, according to analytics firm Vortexa.  It’s carrying about 380,000 barrels of naphtha, a petroleum product Venezuela needs to thin out its thick, sludgy crude so it can flow through pipelines for export.  In an interview with Fox Business Network on Thursday, US Secretary of the Interior Doug Burgum reaffirmed Washington’s intent to “knock Russia out of the Venezuelan oil market,” including by prohibiting the sale of Russian naphtha to Caracas.

headline: Chevron Could See $700 Million-a-Year Boost From Venezuelan Oil
summary: Chevron, the only US oil major currently operating in Venezuela, has a “differentiated opportunity among peers to increase production,” Jason Gabelman, an analyst at TD Cowen wrote in a note Friday.  Its efforts could add between $400 million and $700 million a year, representing about 1% to 2% of the company’s cash flow from operations, he said.

content.title: Chevron Could See $700 Million-a-Year Boost From Venezuelan Oil
content.summary: Chevron, the only US oil major currently operating in Venezuela, has a “differentiated opportunity among peers to increase production,” Jason Gabelman, an analyst at TD Cowen wrote in a note Friday.  Its efforts could add between $400 million and $700 million a year, representing about 1% to 2% of the company’s cash flow from operations, he said.

headline: Trump meets oil executives, says $100 bn pledged for Venezuela
summary:
US President Donald Trump met with the heads of major oil companies on Friday after saying the world's biggest producers have pledged $100 billion to revive Venezuela's oil sector.In a Truth Social post, Trump said "at least 100 Billion Dollars will be invested by BIG OIL."
The Trump administration has repeatedly said it is running Venezuela, with Wright asserting that Washington will control the country's oil industry "indefinitely."

content.title: Trump meets oil executives, says $100 bn pledged for Venezuela
content.summary:
US President Donald Trump met with the heads of major oil companies on Friday after saying the world's biggest producers have pledged $100 billion to revive Venezuela's oil sector.In a Truth Social post, Trump said "at least 100 Billion Dollars will be invested by BIG OIL."
The Trump administration has repeatedly said it is running Venezuela, with Wright asserting that Washington will control the country's oil industry "indefinitely."

thumbnail.caption: Venezuela has about a fifth of the world's oil reserves, but years of sanctions and underinvestment mean it accounts for only about one percent of global production (Federico PARRA)
